title: Govt reduces VAT on dates for Ramadan
body: The government has decided to reduce VAT and taxes on dates to make them more affordable during the upcoming month of Ramadan. The decision was taken at the weekly meeting of the Advisers' Council held today at the Chief Adviser's Office, with Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus presiding. Briefing reporters after the meeting at the Foreign Service Academy, Chief Adviser's Press Secretary Shafiqul Alam said the existing 52 percent VAT-tax on dates will be reduced to 40.70 percent. The meeting also approved draft ordinances on the Commercial Courts Act, National Legal Aid, and Registration. In addition, the council approved Tk 20 lakh in compensation for the families of those killed in the Milestone College jet crash and Tk 5 lakh for the injured. The government will also provide long-term treatment free of cost to those requiring it.
